So if you don't know,

surstromming is an
infamous Swedish delicacy
made of fermented Baltic sea herring.
In spring, the spawning fish are caught
between Sweden and Finland.
Then the heads are removed,
and the bodies are stored in a series
of salted water solutions.
After roughly two months,

the partially preserved
herrings are transferred
to airtight tins,

where they continue to ferment
for up to another year.
